edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter

Class EntityManager<E extends EntityInterface,L extends Location>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter.EntityManager<E,L>

  • public class EntityManager<E extends EntityInterface,L extends Location>
extends java.lang.Object
    EntityManager stores an association between Entities and their Locations.

    ram

    • Constructor Detail

      • EntityManager

        public EntityManager()
        Constructor for the EntityManager. This method initializes the Bi Multi Map for storage of Entities on the map.

    • Method Detail

      • whereIs

        public L whereIs(E e)
        Returns the Location of an Entity e, or null if the Entity e is not found on the map.
        Parameters:
        e - the Entity to look for
        Returns:
        the Location of e, or null if e is not found on the map

      • remove

        public void remove(EntityInterface e)
        Removes the Entity e from the map. This method does nothing if the Entity e is not found on the map.
        Parameters:
        e - the Entity to remove

      • contents

        public java.util.List<E> contents(L loc)
        This method will return,
        • a List containing all Entities in the target Location loc or
        • an empty List if,
          • no such Location loc is found or
          • if there are no Entities in that Location loc
        Parameters:
        loc - Location being queried
        Returns:
        list of all Entities in loc or an empty list

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(E e,
                        L loc)
        Sets the new Location of Entity e to Location loc. This method will remove the Entity e from its original location.
        Parameters:
        e - the Entity to move
        loc - the destination Location

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Allow time to pass.

        Tells each Entity in the world to update itself and/or schedule an Action.

      • seesExit

        public boolean seesExit(E e,
                        Direction d)
        Returns true if and only if the specified Entity e is in a Location that has a neighboring Location in the specified Direction d, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        d - Direction to check for exit
        e - Entity in question
        Returns:
        true if and only if e can see an exit in Direction d

      • getActionsFor

        public <A extends ActionInterface> java.util.List<A> getActionsFor(Actor<A> a)
        Returns a list of Actions available to the given Actor.

        This includes Actions intrinsic to the Actor as well as Affordances belonging to other Entities in the same Location. No checking is done as to whether the Actor can actually perform the Actions.

        Parameters:
        a - the Actor for whom the the list of Actions is required
        Returns:
        List of possible Actions
